title: WeWork Suffers a Credit Downgrade After IPO Delay, Management Shakeup
text:
Text size

Scott Olson/Getty Images

S&P Ratings has downgraded WeWork’s credit, one week after its parent company delayed its initial public offering and two days after CEO Adam Neumann stepped down.

The credit analysts downgraded WeWork’s credit rating by one notch, to B- from B, and said the company has “less than adequate” liquidity. Without an infusion of cash—whether from an IPO or a private investment—WeWork could run out of cash by early next year, the analysts wrote.

They also questioned the company’s new management and governance structure after Neumann’s departure.
description: S&P Ratings downgraded the company’s credit rating by one notch, to B- from B, and said the company has “less than adequate” liquidity.
